clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study on Dosage of Qizhi Weitong Granules in the Treatment of Irritable Bowel Syndrome （IBS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Clinical Trial of Qizhi Weitong Granules in the Treatment of Abdominal Pain Symptoms in Diarrhea-type Irritable Bowel Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: China Resources Sanjiu Medical & Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: China Resources Sanjiu Medical & Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study are as follows: 1) To evaluate the efficacy and safety of Qizhi Weitong granules in the treatment of diarrhea-type irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D);2) To explore the dosage of Qizhi Weitong Granulesin treatment of IBS-D.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study was divided into three groups: Qizhi Weitong granule high-dose group, Qizhi Weitong granule low-dose group and placebo group

primary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded daily by patients from baseline to day56
primary_outcome.description: the most severe abdominal pain score in the past 24 hours, with a weekly mean decrease of at least 30% from baseline;

primary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded daily by patients from baseline to day56
primary_outcome.description: Record daily by symptom diary card.Stools were recorded according to Bristol Stool Chart.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded daily by patients from baseline to day56

secondary_outcome.description: The IBS symptom severity questionnaire consists of four questions on a 100-point scale, with the highest score being 100 and the lowest being 0. The higher the score, the more severe the symptoms.

The IBS Quality of Life scale has 34 questions, and adopts a five-level scoring system, with the highest score of 4 points and the lowest score of 0 points. The higher the score, the more serious it is.
There are 20 questions in the self-rating anxiety scale, which is graded at four levels, with the highest score being 4 and the lowest score being 1. The higher the score is, the more serious it is.

There are 20 questions in the Self-rating Depression Scale, which is graded at four levels, with the highest score being 4 and the lowest score being 1. The higher the score is, the more serious it is.
Subjects may take Piaverium bromide tablets 3-4 tablets per day if they feel unbearable abdominal pain, and increase to 6 tablets per day if necessary.
